Abstract: The integration of microfluidic technology into wearable devices presents a transformative approach for continuous biomarker monitoring, offering real-time health insights. This study explores the design and application of lab-on-chip devices tailored for wearable microfluidic analysis. By leveraging advanced microfluidic design principles, these devices enable precise fluid manipulation and biomarker sensing in a compact, user-friendly format. The continuous assay capability of these wearables facilitates dynamic health monitoring, providing critical data for personalized medicine. Key innovations include the development of robust, flexible materials that ensure device durability and comfort, alongside miniaturized sensors for accurate detection of physiological changes. The research highlights the potential of wearable microfluidics to revolutionize healthcare by enabling non-invasive, continuous monitoring of biomarkers, thus paving the way for early disease detection and management. Future directions involve enhancing device sensitivity and expanding the range of detectable biomarkers to broaden clinical applications.
